definition: Boyle (name)/Robert Boyle (1627-91), British and Irish scientist and pioneer chemist
wave/ripple/storm/surge
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: China has been no exception to the world-wide celebrity of Susan Boyle.
sentences.chinese: 世界名人苏姗波义耳对中国也不例外。

sentences.english: But in addition, Boyle made room for empty space.
sentences.chinese: 但是波义耳却为真空留出了空间。

sentences.english: 'Melissa Boyle Mahle,' she says, extending her hand.
sentences.chinese: “梅丽莎波义耳马勒，”她说，并且伸出手来握手。

sentences.english: Morgan said Boyle may have lost because of overkill in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 摩根说，波义耳因为在英国过火可能失去。

sentences.english: If you read Locke, it's very useful to have in mind the comparison with Boyle.
sentences.chinese: 在学习洛克时，把他和波义耳作比较会非常有帮助。

sentences.english: Now, Locke was a friend of Boyle.
sentences.chinese: 此外，洛克还是波义耳的朋友。

sentences.english: Now, very importantly Boyle's theory is different from Descartes.
sentences.chinese: 波义耳和笛卡尔的理论大相径庭。

sentences.english: Boyle was interested in chemistry, he worked in Oxford.
sentences.chinese: 波义耳对化学比较感兴趣，他的工作在牛津展开。

Albert Einstein (1879-1955), German-born theoretical physicist
